data.title: Withnail’s Bruce Robinson: ‘Hollywood makes movies for halfwits and 12 year olds.’
data.meta_description: A bottle of beer in one hand, a cigar in the other, Bruce Robinson is surrounded by bougainvillea and hummingbirds.  For the first time in 17 years, the writer and director who spawned Withnail & I
data.text:
A bottle of beer in one hand, a cigar in the other, Bruce Robinson is surrounded by bougainvillea and hummingbirds.

For the first time in 17 years, the writer and director who spawned Withnail & I is back in Hollywood in a professional capacity. He’s promoting the first film he’s been proud of since Thatcher was in No 10 — The Rum Diary, a twisted love story based on a novel by Hunter S. Thompson and starring Johnny Depp, the world’s most bankable actor. “It’s a good flick. I’m not displeased with it. Not at all,” Robinson says, flashing his impish smile.

The sunshine, the glamour, the fact that he’s alive to taste the booze — they’re all part of a remarkable third act
